column2: §YYellow§g = Generic, §GGreen§g = Province selector, §BBlue§g = National Value, and §WWhite§g = Historical

§gRevanchism, from the French word for 'revenge', is the yearning for the return of land lost to the nation. In love, war, and peace alike, our people will be willing to make greater sacrifices for the return of our sacred soil.\n§YEvery 5 points of revanchism raises maximum soldier % in a core province by 0.5% and mobilization pool by 0.5%.
Prevent spam of Event to allow duplicate generals.
Culture Row Completion 3\n§G+5 §WLand Unit Starting Experience
You can now build Province Selector buildings.

§WProvince RGO Expansion Flag\n§YIn Victoria 2, when a province changes owners, all old province modifiers are automatically removed. This flag allows RGO expansions to be remembered and transferred if a province changes ownership.

§YSmall State CB Flag\n§WThis flag enables the Acquire Small State CB to be used against this state and is automatically added to all states with less than 150K population before 1860, less than 200k between 1860-1885, less than 300k between 1885-1910, and less than 450k after 1910. When this state's population rises above the small state threshold this flag will be removed at the start of the following year. §RSmall State CB cannot be used on capital states or uncivilized Sub-Saharan African nations.§!

§YMedium State CB Flag\n§WThis flag enables the Acquire Small State CB to be used against this state and is automatically added to all states with less than 300K population before 1860, less than 400k between 1860-1885, less than 600k between 1885-1910, and less than 900k after 1910. When this state's population rises above the small state threshold this flag will be removed at the start of the following year. §RMedium State CB cannot be used on capital states or uncivilized Sub-Saharan African nations.§!
This invention unlocks another national idea.

This effect is additive, e.g. if your army morale is 200%, this will raise it to 250%.

This effect is multiplicative. The max organization of a land unit is (base organization of unit + army organization from techs) * (1 + land organization). An infantry brigade has a base organization of 30, so without any techs researched the max org it will have with this modifier is (30 + 0) * (1 + 0.2) = 36.
This reduces supply consumption for all units by 15%.
This gives -15% Supply Consumption Bonus. For example, if the base supply consumption of your armies is increased to 200% from techs, this will lower it to 170%.

This bonus reduces POP deaths from combat casualties to a rate of 1 to 0.208, down from a base rate of 1 to 0.25. POP deaths from combat casualties is calculated as SOLDIER_TO_POP_DAMAGE/(1 + military_hospital modifier). The base SOLDIER_TO_POP_DAMAGE in this mod is 0.25, so a military hospital modifier of 20% or 0.2, reduces POP deaths to 0.25/(1 + 0.2) = 0.208.

This bonus reduces POP deaths from combat casualties to a rate of 1 to 0.208, down from a base rate of 1 to 0.25. POP deaths from combat casualties is calculated as SOLDIER_TO_POP_DAMAGE/(1 + military_hospital modifier). The base SOLDIER_TO_POP_DAMAGE in this mod is 0.25, so a military hospital modifier of 20% (0.2), reduces POP deaths to 0.25/(1 + 0.2) = 0.208.
Each point of experience lowers the damage taken during combat at the same rate as one point of military tactics.

This bonus increases reinforce rate by +15%. No matter the reinforce rate however, your units' reinforce rate is multiplied by the amount of supplies they are getting, so if your armies aren't getting any supplies they won't reinforce even with a large reinforce rate bonus.
Your units' reinforce rate is multiplied by the amount of supplies they are getting, so if your armies aren't getting any supplies they won't reinforce even with a large reinforce rate bonus.
Navy Build Speed National Idea\n§WNavies: Build Time §G-30%\n§WLocal Ship Repair Speed: §G+50%
Base build time of ships is reduced by 30% and repair is 50% faster. The base build time reduction stacks with base build time reductions from port levels and other techs.

This effect is multiplicative. The max organization of a naval unit is (base organization of unit + navy organization from techs) * (1 + navy organization). For example, a frigate has a base org of 30, and if it has +18 org from techs, the max org it will have with this modifier is (30 + 18) * (1 + 0.15) = 55.2.

Assimilation rate is multiplied by the assimilation chance to determine the amount of assimilation in a POP. If either assimilation rate or chance is 0, or there is no assimilation target, then no assimilation will take place. POPs will never assimilate in a province they have a core in, so e.g. Romanian POPs in Romanian cored land won't assimilate but Romanian POPs in non Romanian land will assimilate.
Provides an output bonus to various factory produced consumer goods.
Provides an output bonus to various factory produced industrial goods.

Unlocks Migration Attraction decision, which redirects incoming immigrants and internal migrants to the targetted province. This does NOT increase the amount of outside POPs that immigrate to your country.
Removes all current province migration modifiers.

Gives a small baby boom modifier to the selected state and adds a 15 year cooldown timer. The duration is inversely proportional to the size of the state, e.g. a state with 90K population will have the modifier last 10x longer than a state with 900K population. Cannot be used on states above 1M population.

Gives a permanent RGO efficiency bonus and +0.03 militancy modifier to the selected province. Cannot use on gold mines and has a 10 year cooldown.

Changes the selected province's trade good to precious metal to represent the new financial hub of your country. Can only use this decision once and it must be on core territory.

A province with a supply depot will reduce attrition to 0 regardless of supply cap and should be used as a rallying point for mobilized troops. You can only have one supply depot at a time, it must not be overseas, and if a battle occurs in a province with a supply depot or the province is occupied by an enemy army it will be destroyed.
Removes the Supply Depot modifier from all provinces.
We require time to procure new supplies before we can build another supply depot.

If you say yes to this event, all of §R$FROMCOUNTRY$'s§b provinces under our control (not ownership) will revert back to their control. The purpose of this event is to speed up the addition of wargoals in case the side that occupies more territory surrenders during a multiplayer war.
Do not return their occupied provinces.
§R$FROMCOUNTRY$§b has agreed to unoccupy our territory in order to help speed up negotiations.
§R$FROMCOUNTRY$§b has not agreed to unoccupy our territory.
In order to prevent spamming, we cannot ask for another cease fire until this timer runs out.

This will trigger an event to all player controlled nations that occupy your provinces. If they accept, all your provinces that are controlled (not owned) by that country will revert to your control. This is to help speed up the adding of wargoals during peace talks in multiplayer games. §WDon't use this decision unless one side has surrendered.
Choose to change a province to the following RGO types.
Change province to produce Tea Leaves.
Change province to produce Coffee Beans.
Add or remove the martial law modifier which gives -0.07 militancy/consciousness, -0.05% tax efficiency, and a debuff to POP promotion.
Trigger an event for each vassal which then triggers an event from them to us in which we can decide to free them or not.
Should we declare or rescind martial law?
This province is currently under martial law.
The country is currently under martial law. This negatively impacts POP promotion rate.
Trigger an event for each vassal which then triggers an event from them to us in which we can decide to free them or not.
Make each vassal send an event to us that lets use choose to free them or not.
Our overlord is considering granting us our freedom.
The geneva convention military hospital and infamy modifiers will be added to your country now

Gives a large bonus to migration to the targeted province. This decision does not increase the chance of receiving immigrants from other countries, it only redirects them to the targetted province. If a province has more than 5% RGO unemployment then the modifier will stop working and should be reset.

Gives a large bonus to migration to the targeted province. This decision does not increase the chance of receiving immigrants from other countries, it only redirects them to the targetted province. If a province has more than 5% RGO unemployment then the modifier will stop working and should be reset.
You may pick from one of the following national idea groups.

In Victoria 2, when a province changes owners or is turned from a colony to a state, all old province modifiers are automatically removed. This province event adds an RGO expansion modifier to any recently acquired provinces and former colonies that previously had them.
Can use on states <150K population before 1860, <200k between 1860-1885, <300k between 1885-1910, <450k after 1910.
Can use on states <300K population before 1860, <400k between 1860-1885, <600k between 1885-1910, <900k after 1910.
The USCA served no purpose but to disunite the people of Spanish North America. This insult to Mexico's sovereignty has been corrected for

While the Jewish don't fit in to all aspects of polish society, foreign threats call for unification. We must utilize our large Ashkenazi population to defend our homeland and end their exemption from conscription.
We have achieved victory in Ukraine against the Russians. It is time to bring the Ruthenians back into the fold.

The institution of serfdom -- unfree farm labour tied to the land of a local noble, effectively a form of feudal slavery -- had existed in various forms in Russia since the Kievan Rus of the 11th century. Throughout the ages the institution had undergone several reforms and changes, but the first steps toward a complete abolishment were taken only in the 1810s, when the institution was abolished in the Russian domains of Kurland, Estonia and Livonia. Even when the Decembrist Revolution overthrew autocracy, the government refused to attempt to abolish it, as the powerful nobles were too fond of the system.
Non-Accepted Bureaucrats Fix Cooldown is 10 years.
Prevents Pandemic Influenza from recurring in your country as long as modifier is active.
